fragrance_families.name: Citrus
fragrance_families.description: Fresh, zesty, and uplifting. Citrus fragrances are characterized by bright notes from fruits like lemon, bergamot, orange, and grapefruit. Perfect for daytime wear and warm weather.

fragrance_families.name: Floral
fragrance_families.description: Romantic and feminine. Floral fragrances feature the scent of flowers like rose, jasmine, lavender, and lily. Can range from light and fresh to rich and heady.

fragrance_families.name: Woody
fragrance_families.description: Warm, earthy, and sophisticated. Woody fragrances are built on notes like sandalwood, cedarwood, and vetiver. They provide depth and longevity.

fragrance_families.name: Oriental/Resinous
fragrance_families.description: Exotic, warm, and sensual. Features rich notes like amber, vanilla, and various resins. Often combined with spices for complexity.

fragrance_families.name: Fresh/Green
fragrance_families.description: Crisp and natural. Green fragrances evoke cut grass, leaves, and herbs. They're invigorating and clean.

fragrance_families.name: Gourmand
fragrance_families.description: Sweet and edible. Gourmand fragrances smell like desserts and feature notes like vanilla, chocolate, caramel, and tonka bean.

top_notes.description: The first impression, lasting 15-30 minutes. Usually light, fresh, and volatile.
top_notes.function: Attracts attention and creates initial impression

middle_notes.description: The heart of the fragrance, emerging after 30 minutes and lasting 2-4 hours. Provides character.
middle_notes.function: Defines the fragrance character and style

base_notes.description: The foundation, appearing after 2 hours and lasting 5-8+ hours. Provides depth and longevity.

formulation_principles.description: A well-balanced perfume has harmony between all three note levels. No single note should overpower others unless intentionally creating a solifore.
formulation_principles.tips: Aim for 20-40% top, 40-50% middle, 20-30% base notes

formulation_principles.description: Great perfumes evolve over time, revealing different facets. Use 8-15 ingredients for complexity without chaos.
formulation_principles.tips: Layer complementary notes, avoid too many competing elements

formulation_principles.description: Use fixatives and base notes with high molecular weight to extend wear time.
formulation_principles.tips: Increase base note percentage, use fixatives like benzoin or labdanum

formulation_principles.description: Sillage (scent trail) is controlled by volatile top and middle notes.
formulation_principles.tips: Increase top/middle notes for stronger projection

formulation_principles.description: Respect IFRA guidelines and skin sensitivity limits for each ingredient.
formulation_principles.tips: Never exceed maximum usage levels, especially for potential allergens

blending_tips: Start with a concept or story you want to tell
Choose a dominant family and build around it
Use the rule of thirds: one-third dominant, one-third supporting, one-third accent notes
Test as you go - smell on blotter strips and skin
Let blends macerate for at least 48 hours before final evaluation
Keep detailed notes of your formulations
Consider the season and occasion for the wearer
Don't be afraid to break rules once you understand them

common_pairings.effect: Luxurious and opulent, Middle Eastern style
